decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury while disrupting the opponent's plans with cards like Solitude and Consign to Memory. Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Quantum Riddler provide additional ways to pressure the opponent. Ephemerate and Teferi, Time Raveler offer versatility and protection, allowing the deck to control the pace of the game. The deck also includes a mix of removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Prismatic Ending to deal with opposing threats. Overall, the deck aims to maintain board presence and apply consistent pressure to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo involving Basking Broodscale and Blade of the Bloodchief to generate massive amounts of mana and overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of Eldrazi creatures. The deck also includes disruption and control elements to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. It aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and win the game in a explosive fashion, with Emrakul, the Promised End as a powerful finisher. The deck utilizes cards like Urza's Saga and Eldrazi Temple to ramp up and accelerate its game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifact creatures and artifacts to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By efficiently using mana ramp cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum, along with the powerful artifact token generation from Urza's Saga, the deck aims to build a wide board presence early in the game. Emry, Lurker of the Loch provides card advantage by recurring artifacts from the graveyard, while Tormod's Crypt and Engineered Explosives help disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck's key concept is to rapidly deploy threats and disrupt the opponent's plans in a fast-paced aggressive strategy.

The key concept of this deck is to play aggressively with low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, while also having instant spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart for removal and damage. Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration help with card selection and ensuring a consistent flow of threats. The inclusion of Slickshot Show-Off and Cori-Steel Cutter provides additional pressure and disruption to the opponent's game plan. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure efficient casting of spells and to support the deck's overall strategy.

The deck focuses on using lands and ramp spells to quickly search for and put into play Primeval Titan, which then allows for explosive combos with lands like Lotus Field and Gruul Turf. The goal is to create a powerful board state with multiple lands in play, utilizing Amulet of Vigor to untap lands and generate a significant advantage over the opponent. The deck's key strength lies in its ability to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful land-based interactions.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful combo cards to win without the need for traditional lands. By quickly assembling the necessary pieces and disrupting the opponent's strategy, the player aims to create a strong advantage and overwhelm the opponent with a mix of control and combo-based tactics. The deck aims to control the game through counterspells, disruption, and card advantage, while also having the ability to quickly close out the game with powerful combo finishers like Goblin Charbelcher. The goal is to outpace and outsmart the opponent through careful planning and resource management.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying a swarm of artifacts, utilizing cards like Memnite and Pinnacle Emissary to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression. Salvage Titan provides a powerful late-game threat while Kappa Cannoneer and Weapons Manufacturing offer removal options. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Tormod's Crypt and Sink into Stupor. Urza's Saga helps find key artifacts like Mox Opal and Engineered Explosives. The deck aims to maintain constant pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with a combination of creatures, artifacts, and removal spells.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures such as Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, supported by burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart. Mishra's Bauble provides card advantage and helps trigger prowess. The deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Slickshot Show-Off and Unholy Heat. The inclusion of cards like Preordain and Expressive Iteration helps maintain card advantage and card selection. The deck shines in its ability to apply pressure early and efficiently close out games.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays with a mix of creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm opponents. The key strategy is to efficiently use mana and maximize damage output with a combination of powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Scion of Draco, backed up by burn spells like Lightning Bolt. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Leyline of the Guildpact and Stubborn Denial to protect its creatures and maintain board control. Overall, the goal is to maintain pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling the Allosaurus combo by tutoring for key pieces and ramping into big creatures. It combines cards like Allosaurus Rider and Neoform with Pact spells to search for combo pieces and ensure protection. The deck also includes powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Ghalta to apply pressure on the opponent. With a mix of ramp, tutoring, and protection spells, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo and overwhelm the opponent with big threats.

This deck focuses on playing small, aggressive creatures like Solitude, Ragavan, and Phelia to pressure opponents early on. Utilizing combat tricks like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Consign to Memory, as well as removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Wrath of the Skies, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a steady stream of threats. Quantum Riddler provides card advantage and Ephemerate offers additional value by blinking creatures for extra ETB triggers. Teferi, Time Raveler can help protect the board and slow down opposing strategies, while the mana base enables consistent casting of spells across multiple colors.

The deck focuses on using instant reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to cheat powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier into play quickly. The key concept is to take advantage of these instant reanimation spells alongside cards like Solitude and Faithful Mending to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up a lethal combo to win the game. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to protect the combo and control the game.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures supported by disruptive cards that can slow down opponent's game plan. With powerful creatures like Ragavan and Phage, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early on. The deck also includes removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Prismatic Ending to deal with threats. Ephemerate and Consign to Memory provide additional value by reusing creature abilities and disrupting opponent's strategies. Quantum Riddler helps with card selection and digging for key pieces. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt opponent's plans while applying pressure with aggressive creatures.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Prismatic Ending. The deck also has a versatile removal package with cards like Solitude and Galvanic Discharge. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Consign to Memory and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker while quickly closing out the game with powerful threats like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana through rituals and medallions to cast a powerful spell like Grapeshot or Past in Flames, with the ability to find key cards with Wish. It also includes cards like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Valakut Awakening to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The goal is to assemble the right combination of cards to create a storm of spells and overwhelm the opponent in a single turn, using the deck's synergy and consistency to win the game.

The deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures to control the board and generate value through sacrificing creatures for various effects. By utilizing creatures like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Chord of Calling, the deck can combo off to generate advantage and pressure the opponent. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by effectively utilizing its creatures and combo pieces to create a powerful board presence. With a mix of utility creatures and combo pieces, the deck can adapt to different situations to come out on top.
